channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Florida Is the Perfect Rent-to-Own Market—Should You Take Advantage?
item.description: The Sunshine State offers the exact combination of factors that make this investment option attractive.

item.title: Why Apple’s ‘Crush’ ad is so misguided
item.description: Welcome to Week in Review: TechCrunch’s newsletter recapping the week’s biggest news. This week Apple unveiled new iPad models at its Let Loose event, including a new 13-inch display for the iPad Air, as well as Tandem OLED and a new M4 chip for the iPad Pro. But its ad for the new iPad Pro […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: When Bad Cops Become Private Security Guards
item.description: There’s growing evidence that former officers with troubling histories of abuse can easily find second careers in private security.

item.title: Working It Out: How to Minimize Eczema Flare-ups at the Gym and on the Job
item.description: Three keys to managing your eczema at the gym and then heading off to a productive and itch-free workday.

item.title: What If We Replaced Income Taxes with Property and Sales Taxes? Would Real Estate Investing Even Work?
item.description: A few reasons for—and against—this proposed shift in U.S. tax laws.

item.title: U.K. agency releases tools to test AI model safety
item.description: The U.K. Safety Institute, the U.K.’s recently established AI safety body, has released a toolset designed to “strengthen AI safety” by making it easier for industry, research organizations and academia to develop AI evaluations. Called Inspect, the toolset — which is available under an open source license, specifically an MIT License — aims to assess certain […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Rare Bright Spot for a Canine Lover Doing Time: Raising Puppies to Become Service Dogs
item.description: Adam Roberts reflects on the highs and occasional lows of training Labrador retrievers for the Puppies Behind Bars program.

item.title: Cows Are Potential Spreaders of Bird Flu to Humans
item.description: Cow udders have the same receptors for flu viruses as humans and birds, raising concerns that cows could become “mixing vessels” that help the bird flu virus spread between people.

item.title: Couple Goals: Navigating Real Estate Investment Decisions With Your Significant Other
item.description: 7 steps to earn your significant other's support in real estate investing.

item.title: At the AI Film Festival, humanity triumphed over tech
item.description: AI startup Runway's second annual AI Film Festival showcased movies that incorporated AI tech in some fashion, from backgrounds to animations. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins the Dart Award for “The Mercy Workers”
item.description: Our feature on mitigation specialists who help save people from the death penalty was recognized for making “significant contributions to public understanding of trauma-related issues.”

item.title: Age-Related Macular Degeneration: Putting a Hole in Our World
item.description: Estimates show that by 2040, age-related macular degeneration may affect nearly 300 million people worldwide. And we are very limited in our ability to treat or prevent it. Here's what to know.

item.title: BiggerNews: Why Low Mortgage Rates Can’t Solve Our Affordability Crisis
item.description: Housing prices won’t budge, but there could be some relief on the horizon for homebuyers. As America’s affordability crisis continues to strain consumers, one of the most considerable costs, housing, […]

item.title: Women in AI: Rachel Coldicutt researches how technology impacts society
item.description: Rachel Coldicutt is the founder of Careful Industries, which researches the social impact technology has on society. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Weinstein Ruling Poses Quandary: Can #MeToo Coexist With Protections for Defendants?
item.description: Proving sex crimes often requires evidence that is generally excluded to protect the rights of the accused.

item.title: A Healthy Lifestyle Can Add Years to Life, Despite 'Bad' Genes
item.description: Turn around those bad family genes with four lifestyle changes.

item.title: Rookie Reply: The Rental Property Expenses You CAN’T Afford to Miss
item.description: How do you know if a rental property will make enough cash flow before you buy? Budgeting is KEY. When breaking down a deal, it’s critical that you account for […]

item.title: SAP’s chief sustainability officer isn’t interested in getting your company to do the right thing
item.description: SAP Chief Sustainability Officer Sophia Mendelsohn wants to incentivize companies to be green because it's profitable, not just because it's right. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Lawmakers Considered Modest Public Defense Reforms. They Rejected All of Them.
item.description: With its refusal to impose oversight or consistent standards in local defense, Mississippi risks falling further behind rest of the U.S., critics say.

item.title: Taking Racism out of the Kidney Disease Equation
item.description: Kidney care in the U.S. is at a watershed moment of moving past a deeply entrenched, institutionally racist equation.
